description:
Needs to monitor your time either at work or at home, so try TimeKeeper. 

Create Categories and projects (with sub projects). Logging can be active for a single project or multiple projects.

Optionally log notes as you start or stop a project. Product pie charts and reports by week, day, and month or for a date range. Report on a complete project. Set a cost per Project/sub-project and these can display on the reports. Email reports or upload to Google docs. 

Backup and restore database to Google docs.

1.3.9
New Features:
* Added Preference for default number of days for Date Range Report.
* Added Preference for starting weekly reports on a Sunday not Monday.
* Added Preference number of days between a backup reminder being shown at application start-up.
* Added Report option to either show 'All Projects' or 'Selected Projects', this automatically toggle All Categories to be 'Yes' if All Projects is 'No', and visa versa.

New Features:
	Added Preference for loading Activity on startup.
	Added a sub-project opens it's parent project.
	Added a new feature to reports to allow 'Rounding to Nearest' with options for 'No Rounding', '5 mins' plus on the full version, '10 mins', '15 mins' and '30 mins'.
	There is a default settings on the 'Report Options', but this can be overridden per project on the project maintenance screen.
	You also have the options to 'Override Nearest To', which turns it off and shows the true times/cost, and 'Rounding Type' which allows to either 'Round to Nearest',
	'Round Up' or 'Round Down'.

Bug Fixes:
	Fixed issue with restoring backups, which caused 'Category ID / Project ID does not match on restore' errors.
	Fixed issue with rounding of costs on Reports.
	Fixed issue with reports starting on Monday.
